text: The re - emergence of FPL in two Australian states in relatively quick succession over a three - year period , caused by two distinct FPV lineages , raises the question as to why this disease is re - emerging now , after decades of apparent quiescence . Animal shelters are conducive environments for pathogen emergence or re - emergence because of a large number of susceptible hosts living in a confined area . This is exacerbated by factors including young age , immunological naivety or immunosuppression , close contact and co - morbidities such as heavy parasite burdens . Similarly , suboptimal biosecurity protocols favour pathogen persistence and fomite transmission [ 34 ] .
